abstract: A session object that monitors and controls image capture for photogrammetry.
overview:
## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession] is used together with an [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureView] to present a view that assists in capturing images of an object for reconstruction of a 3D model by using a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhotogrammetrySession].

A capture session contains functions for starting and advancing the capture session through a state machine that controls the image capture process. Your app can also observe several properties of the capture session to determine the current state of the capture process.

Once a session enters the `.completed` state, your app can transfer the images to a Mac or use them locally on the iOS device for use in object reconstruction using [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhotogrammetrySession]. Model reconstruction is a separate phase which this session does not directly monitor or control.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession
crawled: 2025-12-02T16:13:45Z
---

# ObjectCaptureSession

**Class**

A session object that monitors and controls image capture for photogrammetry.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class ObjectCaptureSession
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession] is used together with an [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureView] to present a view that assists in capturing images of an object for reconstruction of a 3D model by using a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhotogrammetrySession].

A capture session contains functions for starting and advancing the capture session through a state machine that controls the image capture process. Your app can also observe several properties of the capture session to determine the current state of the capture process.

Once a session enters the `.completed` state, your app can transfer the images to a Mac or use them locally on the iOS device for use in object reconstruction using [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhotogrammetrySession]. Model reconstruction is a separate phase which this session does not directly monitor or control.

## Creating a session

- **init()**: Creates a new object capture session.

## Checking availability

- **isSupported**: A Boolean that indicates whether the current device supports object capture sessions.

## Configuring a session

- **feedback**: The current set of active `Feedback` states.
- **ObjectCaptureSession.Feedback**: Provides information about possible problems with the capture session.
- **isPaused**: A Boolean value that indicates if the capture session is paused.
- **state**: The current state of the capture session.
- **cameraTracking**: The current state of ARKit camera tracking.
- **ObjectCaptureSession.Tracking**: A data structure that describes the current tracking state for the camera.

## Monitoring the session

- **ObjectCaptureSession.CaptureState**: State of the capture session.
- **ObjectCaptureSession.Error**: Errors associated with the top-level computation of this class.

## Controlling the session

- **cancel()**: Requests that the capture session be canceled.
- **finish()**: Requests that the capture session be stopped and all data saved.
- **pause()**: Pauses the automatic capture and other resource-intense algorithms.
- **requestImageCapture()**: Requests a manual image capture.
- **resume()**: Resumes object tracking algorithms after [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession/pause()] is called.
- **startCapturing()**: Begins taking images for object capture.

## Structures

- **ObjectCaptureSession.Configuration**: The configuration options for the session which are passed into the `start(imagesDirectory:configuration:)` call.
- **ObjectCaptureSession.Updates**: Used to provide an `AsyncSequence` of change events for the observable properties.

## Instance Properties

- **cameraTrackingUpdates**: The `Updates` `AsyncSequence` for the `cameraTracking` property.
- **canRequestImageCapture**: Will be `true` only when a call to [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession/requestImageCapture()] is expected to be successful. It will be `false` when not in the `.capturing` state or if the session is too busy to currently process a new request. There is a period of time after requesting an image capture where this property will be `false` and a new call to [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession/requestImageCapture()]  will not produce a new image.
- **canRequestImageCaptureUpdates**: The `Updates` `AsyncSequence` for the `canRequestImagecapture` property.
- **configuration**: The read-only `Configuration` used to start the capture session.  The configuration can be set by passing it to the `start()` call and it remains immutable after the session is started successfully.
- **feedbackUpdates**: The `Updates` `AsyncSequence` for the `feedback` property.
- **isAutoCaptureEnabled**: Enables/disables auto-capture system.  If disabled, only manually triggered shots are taken.
- **isPausedUpdates**: The `Updates` `AsyncSequence` for the `isPaused` property.
- **maximumNumberOfInputImages**: The maximum number of images that can be used for on-device reconstruction.
- **numberOfShotsTaken**: The number of shots taken in the entire capture session so far, including both automatic capture and manual capture.
- **numberOfShotsTakenUpdates**: The `Updates` `AsyncSequence` for the `numberOfShotsTaken` property.
- **shouldPlayHaptics**: Enables/disables haptics on devices that support it.
- **stateUpdates**: The `Updates` `AsyncSequence` for the `state` property.
- **userCompletedScanPass**: This property starts out `false` at the start of a capture and will switch to `true` when the user has moved the device in a full circular scan pass around the bounding box of the target object and captured enough data to fill completely the capture dial.
- **userCompletedScanPassUpdates**: The `Updates` `AsyncSequence` for the `userCompletedScanPass` property.

## Instance Methods

- **beginNewScanPass()**: Resets the state of the capture dial such that the user will need to perform another complete scan pass to fill it and generate a new event in the published property [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession/userCompletedScanPass].
- **beginNewScanPassAfterFlip()**: Starts the capturing of a new side of the object, to be called after the object is scanned one side and flipped.
- **resetDetection()**: Moves the session state from `.detecting` back to `.ready` to reset the bounding box and prepare to select a new one with a new call to `startDetecting()`.
- **start(imagesDirectory:configuration:)**: Starts the session with the provided output image directory and optional checkpoint directory.
- **startDetecting()**: Requests that the session should start detecting the object in the center of the camera.

## Model creation

- **Capturing photographs for RealityKit Object Capture**: Take high-quality images of objects to generate 3D models.
- **Creating 3D objects from photographs**: Construct virtual objects to use in your AR experiences.
- **Scanning objects using Object Capture**: Implement a full scanning workflow for capturing objects on iOS devices.
- **Building an object reconstruction app**: Reconstruct objects from user-selected input images by using photogrammetry.
- **Creating a photogrammetry command-line app**: Generate 3D objects from images using RealityKit Object Capture.
- **Using object capture assets in RealityKit**: Create a chess game using RealityKit and assets created using Object Capture.
- **PhotogrammetrySession**: Manages the creation of a 3D model from a set of images.
- **PhotogrammetrySample**: An object that represents one image and its corresponding metadata.
- **ObjectCaptureView**: A view that guides a user through capturing images for object capture.
- **ObjectCapturePointCloudView**: Renders the current state of the point cloud from an object capture session.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Identifiable
- Observable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
